title: Graph of potential difference after switch closed

content.question: A charged capacitor C, resistor R, and switch S are connected in series. Voltmeter V is connected in parallel with the resistor, as shown in the figure above. At time t = 0, the switch is then closed. Which of the following shows the potential difference Î”V reading on the voltmeter as a function of time t after the switch is closed?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled delta V. The curve begins at the origin and extends up and to the right. The curve is concave down, becoming approximately horizontal approximately three fourths of the way along, and high above the horizontal axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled delta V. The curve begins on the vertical axis, high above the origin, and extends down and to the right. The curve is concave up, becoming approximately horizontal and ends near the horizontal axis, far to the right of the origin.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled delta V. The curve begins at the origin and initially extends up and to the right. The curve is concave up, starts approximately horizontally, and then gets steeper high above the horizontal axis.

The figure presents the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled delta V. The line begins on the vertical axis, high above the origin, and extends in a straight line horizontally to the right until it ends.

The figure presents the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled delta V. The line begins on the vertical axis, high above the origin, and extends in a straight line down and to the right until it reaches the horizontal axis, far to the right of the origin.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled delta V. The curve begins on the vertical axis, high above the origin, and extends down and to the right. The curve is concave up, becoming approximately horizontal and ends near the horizontal axis, far to the right of the origin.
